customData.content: 58-year-old Chinese male presented for a physical examination on 20 April 2020. Patient was asymptomatic, with no cough, sputum, hemoptysis, chest pain, or dyspnea. No history of diabetes, hypertension, or family history of cancer. Smoking history of over 7 years, with an average of 20–40 cigarettes per day, and had abstained from smoking for nearly 30 years.

social_history.description: History of over 7 years, with an average of 20–40 cigarettes per day, and had abstained from smoking for nearly 30 years.

HPI.summary: Patient was asymptomatic, with no cough, sputum, hemoptysis, chest pain, or dyspnea.

customData.content: Chest CT revealed a 4.0 cm x 3.4 cm mass in the inferior lobe of the right lung, along with swollen and fused lymph nodes in the hilum and mediastinum. CT-guided lung biopsy revealed lung adenocarcinoma. Immunohistochemical staining positive for Napsin A and thyroid transcription factor 1 (TTF1). Diagnosis of stage IIIA (T2aN2M0) lung adenocarcinoma confirmed on 2 May 2020.

imaging.finding: 4.0 cm x 3.4 cm mass in the inferior lobe of the right lung
imaging.impression: Mass in the inferior lobe of the right lung

imaging.finding: Swollen and fused lymph nodes in the hilum and mediastinum
imaging.impression: Swollen and fused lymph nodes in the hilum and mediastinum

customData.content: Next-generation sequencing (NGS) from tumor tissue via lung puncture identified ELMOD3-ALK (E8: A20) fusion (41.23% abundance) and EML4-ALK (E13: A20) double-ALK fusion (68.21% abundance). ELMOD3-ALK fusion involved a break and rearrangement of exon 8 of the ELMOD3 gene and exon 20 of the ALK gene. ALK fusion confirmed by IHC staining with Ventana D5F3 clone.

imaging.finding: ELMOD3-ALK (E8: A20) fusion (41.23% abundance) and EML4-ALK (E13: A20) double-ALK fusion (68.21% abundance)
imaging.impression: ALK fusion confirmed by IHC staining with Ventana D5F3 clone.

customData.content: Patient started on alectinib 600 mg twice daily on 20 May 2020 for potentially resectable NSCLC with ALK rearrangement. After more than 4 months of alectinib therapy, chest CT scan showed shrinkage of the primary tumor with a 1.1 cm x 0.6 cm nodule in the inferior lobe of the right lung without lymph node enlargement. CEA, NSE, and CA19-9 levels dropped sharply compared to initial levels. Partial response (PR) to alectinib therapy per RECIST 1.1 criteria.

imaging.finding: shrinkage of the primary tumor with a 1.1 cm x 0.6 cm nodule in the inferior lobe of the right lung without lymph node enlargement

labs.value: dropped sharply compared to initial levels
dropped sharply compared to initial levels
dropped sharply compared to initial levels

data.content: Transition from asymptomatic presentation to lung mass detection and diagnosis of stage IIIA lung adenocarcinoma.
Identification of ELMOD3-ALK and EML4-ALK fusions via next-generation sequencing (NGS) from tumor tissue.
Initiation of alectinib therapy and subsequent partial response (PR) based on imaging and tumor marker reduction.
